H0.text: Heat from the room is absorbed by the ice cube, which is why an ice cube melts when set out in a warm room.

H1.text: The ice cube molecules move more slowly is the statement that describes the reason why an ice cube melts when set out in a warm room.

H2.text: One side of the ice cube is colder than the other explains why an ice cube melts when set out in a warm room.

H3.text: Heat from the ice cube moves into the air when it is set out in a warm room, causing the ice cube to melt.

A4.text: When ice melts it absorbs as much energy as would be required to heat an equivalent amount of water by 80 Â°C.
